articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: DNC chair says debate may be moved if impeachment trial starts
articles.description: Democratic National Committee Chair Tom Perez tells Ali Velshi and Stephanie Ruhle the upcoming Democratic presidential debate may be moved if the Senate impeachment trial of President Trump begins on the same day.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: McConnell says he has votes to set impeachment trial rules without Dems
articles.description: Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said Tuesday that he has enough Republican votes to start the impeachment trial of President Donald Trump without the support of Democrats, who have been demanding witness testimony.  Sen. Richard Blumenthal joins Chris …

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Chris Jansing breaks down the latest developments in the impeachment inquiry
articles.description: On Day 106 of the impeachment inquiry, Congress returns with a focus on the impeachment process and Iran tensions. Meanwhile, fmr. National Security Adviser John Bolton said he is willing to testify in the Senate impeachment trial if subpoenaed.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Panetta: We never felt that targeting a general in Iran made...
articles.description: Former Defense Secretary and CIA Director Leon Panetta tells Andrea Mitchell that there was never serious discussion about targeting Soleimani during his time in the Obama administration, because the administration was both focused on the 9/11 terrorists and …

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Sen. King: 'I think it is time for the Speaker to send the articles over'
articles.description: Senator Angus King, a member of the Senate Intelligence and Armed Services committee tells Andrea Mitchell that it's time for Pelosi to transmit articles of impeachment for the Senate, as McConnell looks like he has the votes to open the Senate trial without …

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rep. Ro Khanna: ‘There is no argument for why [John Bolton] shouldn't testify in front of the House’
articles.description: Rep. Ro Khanna (D-CA), a member of the Oversight Committee, talks with MSNBC’s Craig Melvin about conversations amongst his colleagues about the possible testimony of John Bolton in front of the House of Representatives.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Iraq War Vet. Rep. Seth Moulton on Soleimani: ‘Of course he posed a threat. He killed some of my friends.’
articles.description: Iraq War Veteran Rep. Seth Moulton talks to MSNBC’s Craig Melvin about what he expects from tomorrow’s congressional briefing on Iran and the need for a coherent strategy to keep Americans safe.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Sen. Duckworth: 'We are not safer now' after Soleimani attack
articles.description: Senator Tammy Duckworth (D-IL), an Iraq War veteran and Purple Heart recipient, joins Andrea Mitchell to discuss the military repercussions of the Soleimani strike. As Iraqi parliament pushes for the U.S. to withdraw troops from the country, Duckworth tells A…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Schiff: Pompeo unwilling to contradict Trump's threats against Iranian cultural sites
articles.description: As Secretary of State Mike Pompeo insists that any U.S. actions against Iran will follow international law, despite repeated threats from the President to target Iranian cultural sites, Rep. Adam Schiff (D-CA), Chair of the House Intelligence Committee, tells…
